name: Network Configuration
title: NK
definition: Identifies that the request was provided in an on-net or off-net configuration.
validEntryNotes: A valid entry of “A” (on-net) indicates a survivable node at the SWC of the service termination point, and may be applicable during the FOC process.
A valid entry of “B” (off-net) indicates a non- survivable node at the SWC of the service termination point, and may be applicable during the FOC process.
A valid entry of “C” (On-net SECLOC/On-net SWC) (Single) indicates a survived SECLOC, with path diversity, with no SWC diversity.
A valid entry of “D” (On-net SECLOC/On-net SWC) (Diverse) indicates a survived SECLOC and survived SWC with Ring diversity.
